ai-iti26:1.1_0: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
ai-iti26:2.1_0: “Mendicants, if sentient beings only knew, as I do, the fruit of giving and sharing, they would not eat without first giving, and the stain of stinginess would not occupy their minds.
ai-iti26:2.2_0: They would not eat without sharing even their last mouthful, their last morsel, so long as there was someone to receive it.
ai-iti26:2.3_0: But because the result of sentient beings don’t know or see the result of giving and sharing, they eat without first giving, and the stain of stinginess.”
ai-iti26:2.4_0: That is what the Buddha said.
